title: Riding the consolidation wave
summary: A surge of mergers between major satellite operators is rippling through the broader commercial space industry, promising more change in what are already transformational times for the market.

title: Watch live: Blue Origin ready for uncrewed suborbital launch today
summary: Blue Origin is set to launch its New Shepard suborbital rocket from West Texas to space Monday, but this time it will fly without any human passengers. The booster and capsule will loft 36 payloads from research institutions and student organizations, half of which are funded by NASA. The launch window opens at 9:30 a.m. EDT (8:30 a.m. CDT; 1330 GMT).

title: Surging demand for satellite data services, Euroconsult forecast
summary: At a time of dramatic change in the satellite communications market, Euroconsult expects companies to expand revenues by introducing new services, attracting additional customers for existing services and cutting costs.

title: White House requests proposals for regulating novel commercial space activities
summary: The White House will ask federal agencies for their proposals for how to authorize and supervise emerging commercial space capabilities that don’t fit into current regulatory regimes.

title: KT SAT orders Koreasat 6A communications satellite from Thales
summary: Thales Alenia Space said Sept. 17 it has signed a contract to deliver a communications satellite for South Korea’s KT SAT in the fourth quarter of 2024.
